wikipedia_page.main: Jon Leyne (28 February 1958 – 27 July 2013) was the Cairo correspondent for BBC News and its 24-hour television news channels BBC World News and BBC News, as well as the BBC's domestic television and radio channels and the BBC World Service. He worked for the BBC for nearly 30 years, and was its correspondent in New York and Washington, followed by Amman in Jordan and Tehran in Iran. He became the BBC's Cairo correspondent in June 2010.

response: * Jon Leyne, (1958-), BBC foreign correspondent, only foreign journalist in Iran during the Green Revolution in 2009

The BBC's Tehran correspondent Jon Leyne said "Iranian media were unusually quick off the mark to report the killing, to show television pictures, and to give the sort of details that usually only emerge after hours, days, or weeks in this secretive state".
* Jon Leyne, 55, British journalist (BBC News), brain tumour.BBC correspondent Jon Leyne dies at 55
